tool.name: Score docked poses using SuCOS
tool.description: Tool to score docked poses using SuCOS

param.name: refmol
param.label: The reference molecule to overlay
param.help: Input in SDF or MOL format.

param.name: tanimoto
param.label: Include Tanimoto calculations
param.help: Whether to handle the distance as Tanimoto.

tool.help:
**What it does?**
This tool determines the shape and feature overlap of docked ligand poses compared to a reference molecule, usually a known ligand. The RDKit FeatureMap functionality is used to do the scoring.
The original SuCOS code is on GitHub: https://github.com/susanhleung/SuCOS The SuCOS work is described here: https://chemrxiv.org/articles/SuCOS_is_Better_than_RMSD_for_Evaluating_Fragment_Elaboration_and_Docking_Poses/8100203
**Input**
Molecules such as an SD file dataset in history.
**Output**
The same SD file with a "SuCOS_Score" property added. A score of 1.0 infers a perfect overlap, a score of 0.0 no overlap. A rule of thumb is that poses with a score greater than 0.5 can be be considered "useful".
